title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a credit for interest paid on education loans.
content: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a tax credit for interest paid or incurred on any qualified education loan during the first 48 months for which interest payments are required to be made. Limits such credit to $300. Allows such tax credit to parents only if the dependent is a student and a personal exemption is claimed for such dependent student. Excludes interest paid on education loans from the definition of personal interest unless a credit or deduction with respect to such interest is taken.
